reviewText: What in the world are they thinking when they included Simba's Pride in the "classic" collection?  Why not include the real classics such as Lion King or Beauty and Beast or Sleeping Beauty.Great to have  the real classics on DVD, though. However, since there are no special  features and other extras with this collector's set, if you have the laser  disc versions, I would not waste money on them.  There is not much  improvement in quality over your laser disc (and some of the CAV laser disc  versions have special features).  But if you were not one of the lucky ones  to pick up the laser disc versions, go ahead and upgrade your tapes.

reviewText: I know that some people would expect special features galore on these DVDs, but aren't the movies what really counts? And for the movies, I'm very grateful that they are on DVD at last. The picture and sound quality  are excellent and I really don't need anything more. These are some of the  best animated movies in history and the only better way to own them is to  have your own cinema theather and 35mm prints - next to impossible for  mayority of us. So, buy them and enjoy them while you can!

reviewText: This is a terrible collection, no extras, far too expensive..they must think we are really stupid to buy this set.That having been said one point needs to be made, the older Disneys films were not originaly filmed in what we call "Widescreen" on DVDs. Snow White, Pinnochio, and I think one or two others were filmed in what we call Pan and Scan. These film are not cut they never were filmed in the wider format, just look at the Wizard of OZ it isn't widescreen either.People need to realize that widescreen films were not possible until about the 1940's or 50's and even then it was soo expensive not all films were made in that format.
summary: Very bad idea, except one major correction to others reviews

reviewText: O.K., having The Little Mermaid, The Jungle Book, Pinocchio, Mulan, Lady & the Tramp, 101 Dalmetians and Peter Pan is Great. But do you think Hercules and The Lion King 2 match these classics? I don't think so!  Moreover, the lack of extra features should not be a Disney standard. After  all, everybody was waiting for these animated pictures in dvd format. That  said, the picture quality of the discs is very good and the sound  corresponds to the period in which the movies were done. Now we are all  waiting for colection #2 which should include Toy story, A Bug's Life,  Beauty and the Beast, Tarzan, Pocahontas, Snow White, Cinderella &  Sleeping Beauty !
summary: I have mixed feelings about this collection.

reviewText: After having read the other reviews after I had already bought the collection there is not much to say. I agree about a distinct lack of extra material which is a must.  I much prefer to see a movie in its original  format (Black & white included).  I was thrilled to see that the  selections had more than just English,English & French.  But when I got  to Pinocchio and Peter Pan I was very disappointed that Spanish was not  included.  With literally millions of hispanics in the USA it should be  automatically included on the DVD. I have many family & friends that  speak other languages and that is one of the principal reasons I bought a  DVD system.  Please, Disney, take the time to make a product worth buying.  With your name and reputation a lot of advertisement is not necessary when  you produce a 5 star Movie properly on DVD!

reviewText: After Glancing through some of these disappointing reviews i feel compelled to set the record straight about this box set.The Walt Disney Animated Anthology-The Classic DVD Collectors Set Box Set came out in 1999 [ i believe] at that time DVD was a new medium , these 9 films are what started Disney's jump on the dvd bandwagon. These films could be purchased seperately or in this Box Set [ i believe these Box Sets  are Numbered , mine is ] at the time, these films were not available on dvd  only Videocassette.  Since the medium was still new, these dvd's had no extra features such  as Games, commentary, or movie trailers  [only a film recomendation page that showed a picture of these 9 films was offered]This box Set was unique in that it had a good mix of the old classics and the Modern classics.  Since, this Box Set came out, some of these films have been released on dvd 2 to 3 times [ Mulan, Lady and the Tramp, The Jungle Book ,The Little Mermaid to name a few ]I gave this Box Set 5 stars , because at the time it was released, it deserved 5 stars [ as nothing else was available]  For the ordinary person hoping to start their collection, i would bypass this Box Set [ it's Too Expensive , for no Frills ] it would be cheaper to buy these films by their latest releases. [ some are even on A Blu-Ray / DVd combo pack]  This Box Set is for the Hardcore Disney Fan who has to have the" Very First Set of Disney Animated Classics that were made on DVD"  Hope this helps.  LA.
summary: The Truth about this Box Set!

reviewText: What is all this rumor about? This is the classic anthology. I understand that some people are really disappointed by the choice of movies - BUT it is very nice. There are only a few of bouns features, which are not necessary to mention BUT it offers some movies which are just not available today. Therefore, my kids and me really like this collection. The picture quality is excellent and the sound quality according to the source - more than 50 year old movies. I don't think that the price is a bargain - not at all. I bought it for about 100$ which makes it somehow a bargain.If the price would not be this high, I would fully recommend this collection to everyone interested in Disney movies. Currently I can only say - buy movies at better price / quality relations than this.

reviewText: This Anthology is the only one available for Disney classic animated movies in any format. Many of these films are the best of Disney including Pinocchio, 101 Dalmatians, Peter Pan, The Lady & The Tramp, The Jungle Book and The Little Mermaid. The problem is that this set of nine classic Disney films is bare-bones without any extras. All the films have also been remastered since this release. Avoid this massively overpriced anthology by buying your favorite films as stand-alone Blu-rays or DVDs instead. Amazon reviewers rate this a lowly 2.5 stars but it has managed to retain its value.
summary: 9-Disc Set of Disney Animated Classics on DVD (1999)

reviewText: Disney = LoveIt is wonderful that they are putting their movies on DVDs now, but really people, don't spend this kind of money on a box set.  The most you should be spending on a DVD is about $10, or $20 if you want it right away.  I have been buying movies for a while, and the most I tend to spend is $5 on one.  This box set has.. what? 9 movies in it? That should be a maximum of $90 in my opinion, and it should be even less since they are boxed together.  Save your money. Wait a while and buy them separately.

reviewText: This boxed-set features many classic disney films, such as: One Hundred and One Dalmatians, Pinocchio, Peter Pan, The Little Mermaid, Lady and the Tramp and The Jungle Book! The rest of them arn't classics, atleast not yet. The Lion King II was very dissapointing, in my opinion!However, even though the the box-set is superb, it still lacks something, and that something is The Lion King and Aladdin! I consider those two to be the best of the bunch! Disney should have included them. I would have given this box-set 5 stars if it wasn't for the absense of The Lion King and Aladdin.Dont get this boxed-set! Disney WILL release another one...I know they will!

reviewText: I agree that if people refused to buy these full-price versions with no extras, the company would turn around and follow what literally every other  studio is doing - adding commentary, and extras - as Pixar is doing with  the special release of "A Bug's Life."  That disc should be a  lesson.  People who bought it early, ended up having to buy it again to get  the extras.  Be careful.

Title: N/A

reviewText: Well, I've read the reviews of the others and I find myself much in agreement.If you're a fan of the Disney 'classics', then you probably won't want to miss the chance to own them on DVD for no other reason than  the fact that a DVD will outlast a tape. These animations are timeless and  will be enjoyed for decades to come. Nice to know that they'll still be  watchable 20 years from now (can the same be said for a VHS tape?).On  the other hand, Disney Studios does not offer much else on the DVD besides  the film itself. While this is okay (I mean, we buy the DVD or Tape for the  film, right?), it's not what I expected to see on the DVD. I had  anticipated some special features - perhaps interviews, the making of the  movie, etc, etc. I was a little disappointed at that and removed a star  because of it.I am also somewhat dismayed that Disney continues to play  their game with prolonged releases and only offering films for a certain  period of time -- as they have done with the VHS series. Does this strategy  really make more money for them? Or does it merely encourage pirated  copies?In addition, I cannot for the life of me discern why they would  release a sequel (Lion King: Simba's Pride) before the original film. This  one factor kept me from buying the set (I bought them individually  instead). Again, remove a star for misguided marketing.All in all, this  is a worthwhile purchase for you if you don't currently have the movies --  or, if you're like me and want to upgrade from Tape to DVD. If you plan to  buy them, do it soon. Disney will stop manufacture and they will soon be  unavailable for an undertermined period of time and the already high price  will only get higher on the secondary market.~P~
Title: N/A

reviewText: Firstly, I gave this a 2 star and not a 1 star because it does contain 1-2 classics such as "The Little Mermaid" "Lady And The Tramp" and "Jungle Book", but other than that, it's far from being a classic!Don't get me wrong! I have been a Disney fanatic ever since I was 5 years old and grew up watching Disney movies. But there are so many classic movies which are not included in this box set such as "Cinderella", "snow White and the Seven Dwarfs", "Beauty and the Beast", "Aladdin", and "Lion King". Ok, so "Mulan" and "hercules" are good movies and are worth watching but I dont think they are classics compared to the movies which I mentioned above; and "Lion King II - Simba's Pride"..Hello! This movie didnt even get released in the theatre and the story itself was weird, so how can anyone put this in the "Classics" category?To everyone out there, if there are some disney movies which you like here, buy them separatly and not this boxed set directly, because Disney is releasing their Platinum Dvd collection, where they will be releasing one Classic movie every year ( last year it was Snow White and this fall they are releasing Beauty and the Beast )..some movies which they will be releasing in their Platinum series will include Aladdin, Little Mermaid, Lion King, Cinderella, Bambi and much much more!Hope this helped :)

reviewText: Since you can easily buy these titles individually at a fraction of the price this collection makes no sense for any Disney enthusiast. Five more Disney DVDs could be purchased for the extra price  being paid for the cardboard box. And Lion King II Simba's pride does not belong in any Disney set dubbed as "classic". Until Lion King and Beauty and the Beast are released Disney has no business releasing a classic DVD collector's set.

reviewText: I am huge fan of Disney movies and when I think of the DVD collection encasing "The Classics,"  the last title I would put on my list would be "Lion King 2-Simbas Pride!"  That "cartoon" is not a classic by any means.  Although Mulan and Hercules are good Disney movies they hardly hold a candle to "Lady and the Tramp," "101 Dalmations" or "The Jungle Book."  Disney really screwed up on this one!  Can you see yourself paying for a $30.00 DVD with no extras, no commentary, no deleted scenes etc..???  Heavens NO!  Consumers are getting smarter about what is considered quality and what goes straight to the junk pile.  This DVD set priced as is, sells each DVD for approximately $33.90 per DVD!  THAT'S RIDICULOUS!! Save your money folks!  Keep your VHS tapes, they still have several years of enjoyment.
summary: This DVD set is a LOSER!!
